Nation Pizza Products has developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) that contains procedures designed to maximize the safety of all employees, contractors, and visitors in the event of an emergency and also guard against environmental consequences.



III.    Facility Identification

The Nation Pizza Products facility is located at 601 East Algonquin Road in Schaumburg, Illinois.  The facility is a producer of custom and branded pizza and prepared foods for the food service industry, and retailers in the United States. 



The NAICS code for the facility is 311412. Many areas of the plant are refrigerated to preserve ingredients, pizza, prepared foods, and dough products.   



The facility uses ammonia for refrigeration, and is regulated under 40 CFR Part 68, the EPA RMP Rule. There are two (2) refrigeration systems onsite that are used for refrigerating pizza and food products. 



The amount of ammonia currently present in the refrigeration system #1 is approximately 13,000 pounds.  Refrigeration system #1 is used to cool production rooms, holding freezers, cheese cooler, glycol chiller, and a frigo blast freezer.  This system is a two-stage system with five (5) high stage compressors and two (2) booster compressors.  Evaporators in the production areas are fed with high pressure pumped liquid from the receiver, the holding freezer evaporators are fed from the intercooler at 32 psi, and the frigo blast freezer is fed pumped liquid at 30 psi from another intercooler.                                                    



The amount of ammonia currently present in the refrigeration system #2 is approximately 32,000 pounds.  Refrigeration system # 2 is used to cool production rooms, spiral freezers, air handlers, dock areas, and a plate and frame glycol chiller.  It is a two

-stage system with four (4) high stage compressors and two (2) booster compressors.  Evaporators in the production areas are three (3) to one (1) liquid overfeed pumped liquid from the intercooler, and the spiral freezers are fed pumped liquid from the recirculator tank.



The total amount of ammonia onsite, considering the quantities in system #1 and #2, is approximately 45,000 pounds, which is above the minimum threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds.

VI.    General Accidental Release Prevention Program

A prevention program is in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemical releases in accordance with the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119) and the EPA Risk Management Program.   However, as discussed through out this document Nation Pizza Products is continuously working on improving this program. 



This prevention program covers those processes that handle ammonia above the threshold quantity for both PSM and RMP rules. The next audit of the PSM program will occur by January 11, 2021, in compliance with the requirement to conduct PSM audits every three years.  The elements of the PSM / Program 3 prevention program and a brief description are listed below.

?    Employee Participation - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific employee participation plan that ensures employees and their represen

tatives are consulted when conducting and developing process hazard analyses and other information required to be developed under the PSM/RMP regulation.  In addition, the employee participation program will ensure employees and their representatives have access to process hazard analyses and all other information required to be developed under PSM/RMP.  

?    Process Safety Information - Nation Pizza Products maintains a site-specific PSI program that ensures information pertaining to the hazards, technology, and equipment of the process are properly developed and maintained. Process safety information for the ammonia process has been compiled and was last reviewed during the PHA that was completed on May 7, 2019.

?    Process Hazard Review - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific PHA program that ensures a PHA is conducted initially, at a minimum of every five (5) years, and whenever a change is significant enough to require a change in PSI.  In addition, this program ensures PHAs are conducted in accordance with OSHA and EPA regulations and ensures findings and recommendations of PHAs are properly documented. Nation Pizza Products conducted a thorough PHA revalidation study for refrigeration system #1 and #2 during April and May 2019.

?    Operating Procedures - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific procedure that ensures operating procedures provide clear instruction for different phases of process operations and ensures they are properly maintained.  Nation Pizza Products updated operating procedures for both system #1 and #2 during August 2004, and most recently reviewed the procedures during April 2019.  Annually, the operating procedures are reviewed and certified as accurate.

?    Training - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific training procedure that ensures employees operating the ammonia process have the knowledge to safely operate the process, are aware of the potential hazards of the process, and understand the causes of pro

cess problems.

?    Management of Change - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific management of change procedure that ensures changes (except for replacement in kind) to the ammonia process, such as additions of new equipment or changes in operating, maintenance, or other procedures are documented. The most recent management of change was initiated on January 29, 2019.

?    Pre-Startup Review - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific pre-startup safety review procedure that ensures a safety review is performed when modifications to the ammonia process are significant enough to require a change in PSI.  The most recent PSSR was conducted on January 29, 2019.

?    Mechanical Integrity - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific mechanical integrity procedure that ensures written preventative maintenance procedures are developed and maintained, preventative maintenance tests and inspections are properly documented, and employees maintaining the process receive adequate training.  Nation Pizza Products formalized maintenance procedures for refrigeration system #1 and #2 during August 2004, and most recently reviewed the procedures during April 2019. Annually, the maintenance procedures are reviewed and certified as accurate.

?    Contractor Qualifications - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific contractor qualification procedure that ensures all contract employers' safety performance and programs are evaluated, a contract employee injury and illness log is maintained, information of potential hazards are communicated between Nation Pizza Products and the contract employer, and required training and information is communicated, such as the provisions of the emergency response plan and control over entrance into process areas.

?    Incident Investigation - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific incident investigation procedure that ensures each incident that either results in a release or could have resulted in a release of anhydr

ous ammonia is investigated, within 48 hours, by a team of at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  This procedure will also make provisions to ensure a report is prepared at the conclusion of the investigation and findings are promptly addressed. 

?    Compliance Audit - Nation Pizza Products has updated a site-specific compliance audit program that ensures compliance audits are conducted at a minimum of every three years to verify that Nation Pizza Products PSM/RMP practices and procedures are adequate and are being followed.  The most recent compliance audit was completed on January 11, 2018, and the next compliance audit will be conducted by January 11, 2021.  

?    Hot Work Permits - Nation Pizza Products has updated a best management practice for hot work.  Nation Pizza Products updated their hot work permit procedures for refrigeration system #1 and #2 during August 2004. Hot work procedures were reviewed during the most recent compliance audit, on January 11, 2018.



VII.    Five-Year Accident History

The Nation Pizza Products facility has not had an accidental anhydrous ammonia release, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage onsite, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage in the last five years.



VIII.    Emergency Action Program

Nation Pizza Products has developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) to ensure that in the event of an emergency the facility personnel are aware of the appropriate actions to take and authorities to contact in order to mitigate the effects of a release. 



Nation Pizza Products has communicated and trained facility employees on proper evacuation procedures and has had interaction (i.e. onsite inspections) with the Schaumburg Fire Department. 



Nation Pizza Products has coordinated their EAP with the Cook County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and the Schaumburg Fire Department.  This coordination effort includes provid

ing each aforementioned agency with a copy of our EAP, providing each with a site diagram and hazardous material information, meeting with Schaumburg Fire Department personnel to discuss the facilities operations/processes, and encouraging periodic on-site inspections and coordination with Schaumburg Fire Department personnel.



Nation Pizza Products' refrigeration personnel will be responsible for investigating and assisting the Schaumburg Fire Department (if necessary) with response to accidental releases of ammonia. 



Several employees on staff have received HAZWOPER training through classroom instruction, on-the-job training and drills. The current HAZWOPER training includes the first responder awareness level, the first responder operations level and hazardous materials technician training. However, the facility does not currently have a full on-site HAZMAT Team.  



The facility has four (4) windsocks (one at each corner of the building) present onsite for use in determining wind direction in the event of an ammonia release and evacuation of the building.



The current Safety Data Sheet (SDS) for anhydrous ammonia is included in Appendix E. 



IX.    Emergency Communications

The telephone numbers of agencies and plant personnel that may be contacted in case of an emergency are available onsite.



X.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Chemical safety is an important part of Nation Pizza Products operations. Nation Pizza Products recently conducted an audit of their Process Safety Management Program and will be dutifully implementing the recommendations from that audit. Continuous improvement in safety is an important goal for Nation Pizza Products. 



XI.    Management Program

Nation Pizza Products has updated a management system to oversee the implementation of the risk management program elements.  This system has assigned qualified person(s) (or position) to assist in the development, implementation, and integration of the risk management program element

s.  If any portion of the program is delegated to others, the names or positions of those individuals will be documented and the lines of authority defined through an organization chart or similar document.  Currently, Alejandro Parra, Safety and Security Manager, is responsible for implementation of the overall Risk Management Program.
